entry.title: New York Marriott Marquis (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that while the New York Marriott Marquis hotel (pictured) was valued at $579.7 million in 2008, the site was sold five years later for just $19.9 million?

entry.title: feedback arc set (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that for round-robin sports tournaments, finding a ranking of the competitors that minimizes the number of upset games is an instance of the feedback arc set problem?

entry.title: Inger K. Frith (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Inger K. Frith, the first woman president of a major international sporting federation, played a key role in returning archery to the Olympics?

entry.title: Glen Cove City School District (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Glen Cove City School District closed the South School in 1966 to remedy alleged de facto segregation in the district?

entry.title: Dreams of Trespass (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the novel Dreams of Trespass, which portrays the patriarchy as un-Islamic, was translated into more than 20 languages?

entry.title: Reginald Green (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in a study for UNICEF, Reginald Green found that more than two million children under the age of five had died in Angola and Mozambique due to the South African apartheid regime's economic policies?

entry.title: oblique subduction (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that most places where tectonic plates ram into each other involve oblique subduction?

entry.title: Atlas Tract (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Atlas Tract is farmland with a population of 0, but is expected to have a population of 42,000 by 2045?
